Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Organizes style characteristics of an ASP.NET mobile control. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The base <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> class contains style characteristics common to all mobile controls. Classes that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> class contain additional style characteristics specific to their associated control.
Due to the diversity of devices supported by mobile controls, all style properties are advisory, and might or might not be honored depending on the capabilities of the target device.
## Examples The following example demonstrates three user-defined styles in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> object. A <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> object holds three values that correspond to the three defined styles. The `OnClick` command event calls the `SelectStyle` function, which changes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.StyleReference%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextView> object.
[!code-aspx-csharp[MobileStyleSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileStyleSample/cs/Default.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MobileStyleSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileStyleSample/vb/Default.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: An enumerated value representing the specified alignment for the style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Alignment%2A> property can be set to any of the following values:
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment.NotSet?displayProperty=nameWithType>|No alignment is set for the specified object.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment.Left?displayProperty=nameWithType>|Aligns to the left.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment.Center?displayProperty=nameWithType>|Aligns to the center.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment.Right?displayProperty=nameWithType>|Aligns to the right.|

Docs.param: The control to which the style properties are applied.
Docs.summary: Applies the properties of a style to a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following control properties are affected:
|Property|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Size%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|The size of the font.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Bold%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|Whether the font is bold.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo.Italic%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|Whether the font is italic.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.ForeColor%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|The foreground color.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.BackColor%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>|The background color.|

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Drawing::Color BackColor { System::Drawing::Color get(); void set(System::Drawing::Color value); };
member this.BackColor : System.Drawing.Color with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified background color for the style. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The specified background color for the style.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unlike the other properties, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.BackColor%2A> property is not inherited from its parent. For example, if you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.BackColor%2A> property to cyan on a parent control, a child control will not inherit a background color of cyan; you must explicitly set the child control's `BackColor` property to cyan, or you must set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.BackColor%2A> property of the parent control and apply the style sheet to the child control. This is consistent with the behavior of cascading style sheets.

member this.ForeColor : System.Drawing.Color with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style. Typically, this property sets the color for the text. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The specified foreground color for the style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.ForeColor%2A> property to display text in different colors. The strings that can be used for colors are a set of fixed colors and hexadecimal RGB values. These values can also be specified as "#bb7023".
You can also use the Microsoft Windows color constants.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Returns `null` if the control is not templated, or if the template does not exist in the selected template set.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a object has an active template set. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: if the style has an active template set; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks To be considered templated, an object must have a [\<DeviceSpecific>](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5984e67a-91cf-4f32-8815-7e7fab3d3b5b) element with a `<Choice>` element successfully evaluated for the target device. The selected choice must have templates defined.

Docs.param: The object containing the view-state information.
Docs.summary: Loads the view state into the of the object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce(v=vs.100)).

Docs.summary: Registers a style property and returns a unique key for lookup. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Called only from inherited style classes.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.RegisterStyle%2A> method to register a string property that supports inheritance and whose default value is an empty string (""). This incomplete example includes a public property, whose implementation accesses an element of this property by using the default indexer property of the base class.

member this.StyleReference : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: A reference to the style properties for a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.StyleReference%2A> property must be the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style> object. You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.StyleReference%2A> property to share styles across controls, either by using inheritance or by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.StyleReference%2A> property of a style sheet. For more information, see [Styles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ba186999-7707-426b-9376-7eed6970e7b1) and [Creating New Styles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/da7f9825-3cc7-4c0f-9800-7d3cb15041d1).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Turns on the tracking of view state in the object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property to `true`. It also calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState%2A> method on the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> object referenced by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style.State%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style. The default value is . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: An enumerated value that specifies the wrapping mode for the style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table contains the definitions of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping> enumerations.
|Enumeration|Value|Description| |-----------------|-----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping.NotSet?displayProperty=nameWithType>|0|No size is set for the specified object. This is the default value.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping.Wrap?displayProperty=nameWithType>|1|Wrap to the next line.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping.NoWrap?displayProperty=nameWithType>|2|The text is not wrapped to the next line.|
